entries.title: Man, Steam's official website has come a long way in 21 years
entries.description: We were so young and innocent in May 2005⁠—Prima was offering Eguides for Valve games, and Counter-Strike: Condition Zero was a whopping $14.95.

entries.title: Discord voice chat is coming to PlayStation 5
entries.description: A voice chat beta is already live.

entries.title: The world's biggest plane, destroyed in Ukraine, will fly again in Microsoft Flight Simulator
entries.description: A deal between Antonov and Microsoft is officially bringing the An-225 "Mriya" to digital life.

entries.title: This upcoming FPS has a website that's a sick throwback to '90s game ads
entries.description: Seriously, how often do you see a marketing website and think "Oh, this is rad."

entries.title: EA's Monster Hunter-like has no plans for microtransactions, all post-launch content will be free
entries.description: Wild Hearts will be getting more monsters, but you're not going to have to pay for them.

entries.title: This genius student uses the power of AI and a 3D printer to 'handwrite' their homework
entries.description: A+ material.

entries.title: This military base-building sim has all of the soldiers and none of the violence
entries.description: One Military Camp is a building and management game in the spirit of Two Point Hospital, coming to Steam in March.

entries.title: Elden Ring streamer strums Margit to death with an actual acoustic guitar
entries.description: Viral Elden Ring dance pad streamer MissMikkaa has found yet another weird way to explore the Lands Between.

entries.title: Season: A Letter to the Future review
entries.description: Narration disturbs Season's attempts at tranquility.

entries.title: The Last of Us Part 1 is delayed because everyone likes the HBO show so much
entries.description: Naughty Dog says the HBO show is so good, it wants to make sure it doesn't half-ass the PC release.

entries.title: Elgato Stream Deck + or Loupedeck Live S? Here's our streaming gadget pick
entries.description: The battle of the desktop whatchamacallits.

entries.title: Dwarf Fortress' next update grants even more ways to torment your minions
entries.description: Arena mode is just what it sounds like.

entries.title: Overwatch 2 is targeting players who play with cheaters even if they're not cheating themselves
entries.description: Over 50,000 accounts have been "actioned" for cheating since launch, and Blizzard's had enough.

entries.title: I lost thousands of soldiers in The Great War: Western Front because I forgot my balloon
entries.description: Hands-on with Petroglyph's brutal WWI RTS.

entries.title: Hose down a filthy Final Fantasy 7 boss at several thousand PSI in Powerwash Sim's upcoming DLC
entries.description: Planet's grimy, Cloud.

entries.title: Intel Core i5 13400F
entries.description: The best budget gaming CPU right now.

entries.title: HHKB Professional Hybrid Type S
entries.description: Move out of the way, the king of small keyboards is here (as long as you can afford it).

entries.title: AMD's new laptop APU nearly twice as fast as Steam Deck in leaked graphics benchmark
entries.description: Could the 780M graphics in new Ryzen 7040 APU actually be tolerable for gaming?

entries.title: Deep Rock Galactic celebrates five years of free updates by letting you play without them, says 'we are not slowing down'
entries.description: All mine.

entries.title: Beef-up Hitman's Freelancer mode with this variant map mod
entries.description: Variety is the spice of taking life.

entries.title: Eagle-eyed gamer spots Starfield feature hiding in plain sight
entries.description: It's visible for just one frame of the gameplay trailer

entries.title: Wordle hint and answer today: Let's solve #594, February 3
entries.description: Get some help with Friday's Wordle.

entries.title: Two years after launch, live-service dodgeball game Knockout City is shutting down
entries.description: Players on PC will be able to continue playing by hosting private servers.

entries.title: Razer's new gaming mouse is its lightest ever
entries.description: Though it sure does have a Razer price tag to match.

entries.title: I kinda miss how much of a pain in the ass it used to be to play games online
entries.description: There were little joys in finding tools like Hamachi to make those early 2000s online gaming problems evaporate.
